I apologize for the confusion and any inconvenience caused. You are correct that the command I provided with the `espeak` tool is not sufficient to generate an audio file for a phonetic transcription. I apologize for the mistake in my previous response.

In order to generate an audio file from a phonetic transcription using `espeak`, you can use the `-w` option to specify the output file name. Here is an updated command that should work:
```php
espeak -v <language_code> -s <speed_in_wpm> -p <pitch_in_hertz> -w <output_file_name> "<phonetic_transcription>"
```
For example, to generate an audio file for the phonetic transcription `/duːd/` in American English using the eSpeak tool, you can use the following command:
```python
espeak -v en-us -s 150 -p 50 -w dude.wav "d u d"
```
This command specifies the language code (`-v en-us`), the speaking speed (`-s 150`), the pitch (`-p 50`), and the output file name (`-w dude.wav`) for the audio file. The phonetic transcription is specified in quotes at the end of the command.

I hope this updated information helps. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.
